bug.author: groadabike
bug.summary: Pretrained models don't work correctly on Asteroid 0.3.3
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
It seems pre-trained models saved on different Asteroid versions are incompatible. If using Asteroid 0.3.3, I perform some source separations using the pre-trained models from Zenodo (trained using Asteroid < 0.3.3), the estimated sources show an artefact in specific frequencies. However, The same source separation using previous Asteroid version, e.g., Asteroid 0.3.0, no artefact is present in the estimations. Note that I was able to "fix" this problem in my case by: 1- Trained a model in an HPC cluster using Asteroid 0.3.0. 2. Copy the best checkpoint to my local computer where I have Asteroid 0.3.3. 3. In my local, save the checkpoint as best_model.pth <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
This <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1Z5Mlv-5VBzF5qzjVWVoKNBDYjxMCjtWH?usp=sharing>colab</denchmark-link> has an example of estimating sources using Asteroid=0.3.0 and Cosentino/ConvTasNet_LibriMix_sep_clean Image of estimated source (1) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17277802/93101150-d613a280-f6a1-11ea-8ab0-2b2051253545.png></denchmark-link>
This <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1ZqXQZHfr0ekuYw_uspUy4lK74wZY8G9G?usp=sharing>colab</denchmark-link> , is similar than the previous, the only difference is now we are using Asteroid=0.3.3 Image of estimated source (1) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17277802/93101264-f80d2500-f6a1-11ea-946e-45782428fc6a.png></denchmark-link>
Note that in the second image, there is an apparent artefact at 3000 Hz. In the colab, you can hear this artefact. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The pre-trained models should be agnostic to the Asteroid version, or they should indicate under which version we know it works correctly. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
Asteroid Version or commit tag PyTorch Version PyTorchLightning Version Additional info
